commit_message:
Add become to all plays

The swift role includes tasks that delegate to the physical host of
containers (localhost in gate tests). Since ansible_become was removed
from localhost's vars, set become in this play to fix tests that install
swift.

Also add the become option to all other plays to avoid this issue for
any other roles that may now or in the future delegate tasks to localhost.

Change-Id: I08cada62636a1a7a1e2c1b15e0052876437e24aa
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-tests refs/changes/64/458664/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: become: true

commit_message:
Make nova metadata protocol configurable

If https is used as internal protocol, and nova_metdata_protocol is
not set accordingly. The service neutron_metadata_agent will raise a
BadStatusLine exception upon receiving metdata request from instances.

Change-Id: Iaf7bd6f444daf766ed7c43c31a02f67964aff50d

commit_message:
Perform an atomic policy file change

The policy.json file is currently read continually by the
services and is not only read on service start. We therefore
cannot template directly to the file read by the service
(if the service is already running) because the new policies
may not be valid until the service restarts. This is
particularly important during a major upgrade. We therefore
only put the policy file in place after the service restart.

This patch also tidies up the handlers and some of the install
tasks to simplify them and reduce the tasks/code a little.

Change-Id: Ie913e5eb75f3601107b53bab7bda4a02ab1c1024
(cherry picked from commit 94293c86c296c2f5c8a2492e1348bca1278ef3ec)

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-04-21 13:45:12.000000000', 'files': ['nova/values.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-helm/commit/1a62ad8bc799b0e48395d0738c59a13d2e74fe81', 'message': 'Nova chart: fix nova->neutron API communication

Removing domain_name from nova.conf in neutron section. domain_name and
project_name cannot be declared in the same section in the same time
for keystone auth.
Otherwise the exception is raised:
AuthorizationFailure: Authentication cannot be scoped to multiple targets.
Pick one of: project, domain, trust or unscoped

Change-Id: I55072d3662a9bfeb76725e5f0b4612b68e980605
'}]
commit_message:
Nova chart: fix nova->neutron API communication

Removing domain_name from nova.conf in neutron section. domain_name and
project_name cannot be declared in the same section in the same time
for keystone auth.
Otherwise the exception is raised:
AuthorizationFailure: Authentication cannot be scoped to multiple targets.
Pick one of: project, domain, trust or unscoped

Change-Id: I55072d3662a9bfeb76725e5f0b4612b68e980605
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-helm refs/changes/46/458846/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Fix create/rebuild tests to not need a ton of neutron
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-04-22 00:15:59.000000000', 'files': ['shade/tests/unit/test_caching.py', 'shade/tests/unit/test_rebuild_server.py', 'shade/tests/unit/test_create_server.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/shade/commit/09af82b11770a4586dca8714f907bffd65dab3c2', 'message': "Fix create/rebuild tests to not need a ton of neutron

The tests are testing nova interactions, but because of _expand_server
they call neutron a bunch. This is hidden with neutronclient for some
reason - I'd look in to that more but we're deleting neutronclient
anyway.

To avoid us having to add a bunch of network mocks that are noise to the
tests, fake out has_service to return false for neutron to skip the
calls. We can then add them in on a case-by-case basis as needed.

Change-Id: Ia877232b8dc167a8414f1601ea82708ff5aa2be9
"}]
commit_message:
Fix create/rebuild tests to not need a ton of neutron

The tests are testing nova interactions, but because of _expand_server
they call neutron a bunch. This is hidden with neutronclient for some
reason - I'd look in to that more but we're deleting neutronclient
anyway.

To avoid us having to add a bunch of network mocks that are noise to the
tests, fake out has_service to return false for neutron to skip the
calls. We can then add them in on a case-by-case basis as needed.

Change-Id: Ia877232b8dc167a8414f1601ea82708ff5aa2be9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/shade refs/changes/26/459026/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def setUp(self): # This set of tests are not testing neutron, they're testing # creating servers, but we do several network calls in service # of a NORMAL create_server to find the default_network. Putting # in all of the neutron mocks for that will make the tests harder # to read. SO - we're going mock neutron into the off position # and then turn it back on in the few tests that specifically do. # Maybe we should reorg these into two classes - one with neutron # mocked out - and one with it not mocked out super(TestCreateServer, self).setUp() self.has_neutron = False def fake_has_service(*args, **kwargs): return self.has_neutron self.cloud.has_service = fake_has_service # TODO(slaweq): change this to neutron floating ips and turn neutron # back on for this test when you get to floating ips # TODO(slaweq): change this to neutron floating ips and turn neutron # back on for this test when you get to floating ips # TODO(slaweq): change this to neutron floating ips and turn neutron # back on for this test when you get to floating ips # TODO(slaweq): change this to neutron floating ips and turn neutron # back on for this test when you get to floating ips # TODO(slaweq): self.has_neutron = True should be added, the mock of # get_network should be removed, and a register_uris containing # a list with a network dict matching "network-name" should be used # instead. # TODO(slaweq): self.has_neutron = True should be added, the mock of # get_network should be removed, and a register_uris containing # a list with a network dict matching "network-name" should be used # instead.

subject: Don't do all the network stuff in the rebuild poll
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-04-22 00:15:59.000000000', 'files': ['shade/openstackcloud.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/shade/commit/7a2b5792522a14c0fc39490e407bbddddc8d7189', 'message': "Don't do all the network stuff in the rebuild poll

When we're polling for completeness during rebuild server, we do not
need to make all of the network calls to fill in network info.

If we wait for the server though, we do return the server to the user,
so fill in the info once at the end.

Change-Id: I78aaf995cb83a88fef9414c17b6bd7fca21fe3c3
"}]
commit_message:
Don't do all the network stuff in the rebuild poll

When we're polling for completeness during rebuild server, we do not
need to make all of the network calls to fill in network info.

If we wait for the server though, we do return the server to the user,
so fill in the info once at the end.

Change-Id: I78aaf995cb83a88fef9414c17b6bd7fca21fe3c3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/shade refs/changes/25/459025/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: detailed=False, bare=False, if not wait: return server admin_pass = server.get('adminPass') or admin_pass for count in _utils._iterate_timeout( timeout, "Timeout waiting for server {0} to " "rebuild.".format(server_id), wait=self._SERVER_AGE): try: server = self.get_server(server_id, bare=True) except Exception: continue if not server: continue if server['status'] == 'ERROR': raise OpenStackCloudException( "Error in rebuilding the server", extra_data=dict(server=server)) if server['status'] == 'ACTIVE': server.adminPass = admin_pass break return self._expand_server(server, detailed=detailed, bare=bare)
deleted_lines: if wait: admin_pass = server.get('adminPass') or admin_pass for count in _utils._iterate_timeout( timeout, "Timeout waiting for server {0} to " "rebuild.".format(server_id), wait=self._SERVER_AGE): try: server = self.get_server(server_id) except Exception: continue if not server: continue if server['status'] == 'ACTIVE': server.adminPass = admin_pass return server if server['status'] == 'ERROR': raise OpenStackCloudException( "Error in rebuilding the server", extra_data=dict(server=server)) return server

commit_message:
Make Cinder Auth Strategy configurable

Cinder supports both noauth and keystone auth mode. This patch adds
cinder_auth_strategy variable to have abililty to configure Cinder's
auth strategy

Change-Id: I7454c9340aff06628aa438301106f2ae8897765c

commit_message:
[upstream] Add links to and improve wording of communication slides

There was some odd wording in the communication slides.  This patch
improves the wording.

Also it adds a note that most teams put meeting agendas on the
team's wiki page.

Links are added to etherpad.openstack.org and to the wiki that
describes how to subscribe to mailing lists/describes our more
popular lists.

Change-Id: Ib9c5f06a873abe6a00e8d0fa8c700f8ad5f1ba4a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/training-guides refs/changes/85/458685/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - Most projects use the OpenStack wiki to post agendasthe meeting is conducted (#openstack-meeting, #openstack-meeting-3, etc).- `https://etherpad.openstack.org <https://etherpad.openstack.org>`_- The `Mailing Lists <https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Mailing_Lists>`_ wiki page describes how to subscribe to a list and describes some popular listsone list of interest. Once subscribed, locate the archives for that ML.
deleted_lines: the meeting is (#openstack-meeting, #openstack-meeting-3, etc).one that would be most helpful for you and then locate where the archives for that ML are.

commit_message:
Add Ref slide for howitsmade-official-projects

There are many links of reference sites/topic used in slide
as note (which are only viewable in presenter view).

Those links are helpful for audience to get further details
and good to mention in reference slide.

This commit add new reference slide with related links.

Change-Id: I2958d524e71b8c86362ec2a8ee3fb9c99f094b1e

commit_message:
Add periodic task to clean up expired reservation

Currently we would have uncommit reservations in database if
the commit operation failed. This could obstruct creating new
shares or others which would consume quota. This patch adds
a perodic task to clean this expired reservations.

Also fix bug in db.reservation_expire method(We dropped
attribute 'usage' from Reservation, but it's still used
in this method).

Closes-Bug: #1669449

Change-Id: I3dc0973ebac5eb33832e242c72059be1eb954369
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/manila refs/changes/55/440155/12 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from oslo_service import periodic_taskfrom manila import quota @periodic_task.periodic_task(spacing=600, run_immediately=True) def _expire_reservations(self, context): quota.QUOTAS.expire(context)

commit_message:
Fix variable exports for deployment

The newline was preventing some of the variables from
being exported properly.

Change-Id: If189f6e288796d828da749c5873983ea46764068

commit_message:
Add new capabilities to ironic

This spec proposes to add few more capabilities
which can be implemented inband or out-of-band
as per driver's need.

Related-Bug: 1599425
Change-Id: I4213668273ffa954dd30818b74a58d11153d5f97
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic-specs refs/changes/38/338138/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode =========================================================== Add more capabilities to ilo drivers out-of-band inspection =========================================================== https://bugs.launchpad.net/ironic/+bug/1599425 This spec adds few more capabilities to ilo drivers out-of-band inspection. Problem description =================== The operator may be interested to schedule and select the hardware based on many other hardware properties like cpu_vt, trusted_boot, etc. Proposed change =============== Following properties will be discovered out-of-band:: capability name: trusted_boot possible values: True|False capability name: iscsi_boot possible values: True|False capability name : boot_mode_uefi possible values : True|False capability name : boot_mode_bios possible values : True|False capability name : sriov_enabled possible values : True|False capability name : iscsi_iqn possible values : vary from hardware to hardware capability_name : drive_ssd possible values : True|False capability_name : drive_rotational possible_values : True|False capability name : rotational_drive_rpm possible values : Integer value capability name : raid_level possible values : current raid level configured ``drive_ssd`` and ``drive_rotational`` are two different properties as the hardware can have both kind of drives attached. There are other changes which would be required for supporting few of the above properties. * Since the boot_mode_* properties deal with the boot mode of the server the ilo drivers would need to read them from instance_info and take an appropriate action. Alternatives ------------- Operator may need to manually configure the node with above properties for nova scheduler to be able to select the desired node for deploy. Data model impact ----------------- None. State Machine Impact -------------------- None. REST API impact --------------- None. Client (CLI) impact ------------------- None. RPC API impact -------------- None. Driver API impact ----------------- None. Nova driver impact ------------------ None. Security impact --------------- None. Other end user impact --------------------- None. Scalability impact ------------------ None. Performance Impact ------------------ None. Other deployer impact --------------------- None. Developer impact ---------------- None. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: Nisha Agarwal <agarwalnisha1980> Work Items ---------- * To add the new properties to the list of supported capabilities in ilo drivers or rather remove the restriction of capabilities from ilo drivers so that ironic doesnt need to change for new out-of-band properties. * This require enhancing proliantutils to return above properties out-of-band for proliant hardwares. Dependencies ============ None. Testing ======= * Test the ilo drivers to return above properties out-of-band. Currently plan is to test above through unit tests alone. Inspection will be part of iLO third party CI once iLO third party CI is stable. Upgrades and Backwards Compatibility ==================================== None. Documentation Impact ==================== Following will be documented under the ilo drivers documentation: - The new properties which would be added as part of this spec. - The nova flavor samples how these properties can be used in creation of required nova flavors. References ========== None.

commit_message:
Add deperecated reference to impl_idl.Transaction

networking-ovn subclassed the Tranaction class, so we need to
keep a reference to it until they too switch to ovsdbapp.

Change-Id: Ifd922fe5d84778d402c4e877d64ac53ee3d6c1ce
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/47/458947/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from ovsdbapp.backend.ovs_idl import transactionTransaction = moves.moved_class(transaction.Transaction, 'Transaction', __name__)

commit_message:
retry to get block on error

When something wrong occurs in coordinator callback we just print a
warning for deployer.But we should also print the root cause and
retry later to get the correct block_size. Otherwise the worker
will never work on its block and an entire will never been processed.

This change tracks the correctness of the block_size and retries if
this one not synced.

Change-Id: Id3fc343cb1556b94af501344a8b016618cbebce3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/gnocchi refs/changes/02/457702/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: except Exception as e: # FIXME(sileht): looks like if something wrong occurs we never # recover is no worker join/leave. We should mark this # process as 'dirty worker' and retry later to fix it LOG.warning('Error getting block to work on (%s), ' 'defaulting to first', str(e), exc_info=LOG.isEnabledFor(log.DEBUG))
deleted_lines: except Exception: LOG.warning('Error getting block to work on, defaulting to first')

commit_message:
Optimise apt cache update task

The update of the apt cache and the package installation
can all be handled in a single task by providing the
package action plugin with the right parameters. This
removes an extra task to optimise execution.

The minimum Ansible version is raised to 2.2 due to a
known bug [1] in Ansible's apt module which does not
update the cache properly if the cache update and the
install are combined in a single task.

[1] https://github.com/ansible/ansible-modules-core/issues/1497

Change-Id: I88ff40f2ae3bca8341daeddfe8c7a23c2addc057

commit_message:
[WIP] Switch to centos-minimal element

Since openstack-infra is a big user of diskimage-builder, it would be
great to align tripleo to use the same base element for centos.  The
major different, the minimal element will create centos via
yumdownloader not an existing qcow2 image.

Change-Id: Ib3a9ba6543f41d2ca07fc11e2bea0c3563af9b62
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Prepare to replace jenkins user with zuul user

This is going to be a 2 step process. First we'll setup jenkins and
zuul together. Once we confirm things work as expected, we'll do a
follow patch to delete the jenkins user bits.

Change-Id: Ic9d11538d1273f6b8a63fde6570cf44cf257070c
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Update api-paste.ini template for Ocata

The default content of api-paste.ini has changed, in particular we were
missing the http_proxy_to_wsgi filter allowing proper URL discovery.

Change-Id: Iaa968a963df5baf49116829f111ef4f46c4f8951

commit_message:
Add spec to drop creating admin endpoints

Change-Id: Ib94500235a04f3ec45066b7b26b2d925f4a37f6e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-chef-specs refs/changes/28/458128/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ======================================================= Stop generating admin endpoints in the keystone catalog ======================================================= The admin endpoints offer no special functionality, users may talk to the public endpoints instead. The only historic use case has been the keystone v2 admin endpoint, but with keystone v3 API, even that is no longer needed. Problem description =================== Currently we generate admin endpoints for almost all services. As the service catalog is sent to the API user for every transaction, this generates some amount of overhead, as these endpoints aren't really needed anymore. Dropping them will also reduce the time needed for chef runs. Proposed change =============== Drop the admin endpoints from all identity_registration recipes in our cookbooks. This will affect: - cookbook-openstack-block-storage - cookbook-openstack-compute - cookbook-openstack-identity - cookbook-openstack-image - cookbook-openstack-networking - cookbook-openstack-orchestration - cookbook-openstack-telemetry Alternatives ------------ Stick to the status quo. Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- None Security impact --------------- Deployments that have been using a different admin endpoint with restricted access may need to switch to using the internal endpoint instead. Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- None Performance Impact ------------------ The size of the service catalog will be reduced, as well as the duration of chef runs, both with positively impact performance. Other deployer impact --------------------- Deployments that in some way make unexpected use of the admin endpoints will need to be adapted. Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: <j-rosenboom-j> Other contributors: <jklare> Work Items ---------- - Update identity_registration recipes - Check for unknown dependencies Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= Our integration tests should have sufficient coverage in order to make sure that this change doesn't have any negative impact. Documentation Impact ==================== None References ========== None

subject: Fullstack: enable DHCP agent
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-30 08:54:17.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/39c8492df976ec7898b9543f7197ef184b4e932e', 'message': "Fullstack: don't enable DHCP on subnets without DHCP agent

With the merge of I8111469ad4b0d88580bff7a77492ad95af8e9377,
ports will not transition to the ACTIVE status on a subnet
that has DHCP enabled that does not clear the DHCP provisioning
block. So if we don't deploy a DHCP agent for these tests,
the ports will not transition to ACTIVE.

This fixes the fullstack tests by disabling DHCP on these subnets
since we don't deploy a DHCP agent to clear the provisioning
block.

Change-Id: I66c5e4ead23f0e6bd4b9e867c8cf419f67f6d78c
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2017-04-04 15:20:49.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/a239cc8d8077212425cac6a01d03e4723bfc6d57', 'message': "Fullstack: enable DHCP agent

ports will not transition to the ACTIVE status on a subnet
that has DHCP enabled that does not clear the DHCP provisioning
block. So if we don't deploy a DHCP agent for these tests,
the ports will not transition to ACTIVE.

This fixes the fullstack tests by adding DHCP agents
to clear the provisioning block.

Change-Id: I66c5e4ead23f0e6bd4b9e867c8cf419f67f6d78c

commit_message:
Fullstack: enable DHCP agent

With the merge of I8111469ad4b0d88580bff7a77492ad95af8e9377,
ports will not transition to the ACTIVE status on a subnet
that has DHCP enabled that does not clear the DHCP provisioning
block. So if we don't deploy a DHCP agent for these tests,
the ports will not transition to ACTIVE.

This fixes the fullstack tests by adding DHCP agents
to clear the provisioning block.

Co-Authored-By: Jakub Libosvar <libosvar@redhat.com>
Closes-bug: #1677729
Change-Id: I66c5e4ead23f0e6bd4b9e867c8cf419f67f6d78c

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-12 21:05:33.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/66e0652ac6b6017b96619b4afb9343d15a65b2cb', 'message': "Show correct values in Edit Port form

Edit Port form expects a string version of True/False
but actaully a boolean value is passed to the field.
As a result, a string 'True' or 'False' is shown rather than
'UP' or 'DOWN'. This can be fixed by converting a boolean
value before returning the initial value.

Closes-Bug: #1672213
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2017-03-13 00:11:12.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/2e7ec5b618e2fc464c4d64e1f16ab3c78c414a80', 'message': 'Handle boolean value correctly in TypedChoiceField

admin_state_up is a boolean value but the network and port edit forms
expected a string version of True/False. As a result, True/False string
was shown as the default value in these forms. "choices" of these fields
should expect a boolean value.

In addition, the networking forms had a logic like
['admin_state'] == 'True' to convert a received value to a boolean.
It is because form fields returns a string version of value
even though choices field contais a boolean value by default.
It looks better to use TypedChoiceField and specify "coerce" function
to convert a received value to an expected type.

As far as I checked, this pattern is used only in the networking
related panels and this patch clean them up.

Change-Id: I9286f6c29d67fec7a88b74661bc8eca945fd9061
Closes-Bug: #1672213

commit_message:
Use BooleanField for admin_state_up form

admin_state_up is a boolean value but the network and port edit forms
expected a string version of True/False. As a result, True/False string
was shown as the default value in these forms. The field is implemented
as ChoiceField, but there is no special reason not to use BooleanField
for a boolean field and admin_state(_up) fields are the only exceptions
in horizon. This commit replaces all admin_state(_up) fields to
use BooleanField.

As far as I checked, this pattern is used only in the networking
related panels and this patch clean them up.

Change-Id: I9286f6c29d67fec7a88b74661bc8eca945fd9061
Closes-Bug: #1672213

commit_message:
Fix the choice of default_role

When there are two similiar roles in the context, such as "baremetal_admin",
"admin", the rally will chose baremetal_admin rather than admin in create_user.
To fix this, use "==" instead of "in".

Change-Id: I6db08e0cd1b2ecfcc258298642dfe3208e00373e

commit_message:
Add release note and update cell install guide for multi-cell limitations

As of change If1e03c9343b8cc9c34bd51c2b4d25acdb21131ff, using
"nova hypervisor-list" before compute hosts are mapped to a cell
will result in an empty list.

Our cells v2 install steps mention using 'nova hypervisor-list' after
creating a cell and starting compute services to tell when to run
the discover_hosts command, but now hypervisor-list won't work until
you've run discover_hosts, so it's a catch-22.

This change adds a release note to let people writing deployment tools
to know about the change in behavior and also updates the install steps
to use service-list instead of hypervisor-list, since service-list does
not require the compute host to be mapped to the cell first.

We are going to need to make a similar change in the OpenStack install
guide since that also mentions using 'nova hypervisor-list' before
discover_hosts.

Change-Id: If2baab40c2e2a3de20e561bba50688d615b002ef
Closes-Bug: #1682060

commit_message:
Tell people that the nova-cells man page is for cells v1

We have to continue scrubbing our documentation for anything
that generically refers to 'cells' since older documentation is
referring to cells v1, and we don't want people to confuse that
with cells v2. This simply provides a warning that cells v1 is
not recommended for new deployments and if you were looking for
help with cells v2 commands, we need to redirect you.

Change-Id: I3bd0332607bff169b5f496d17e4fc7d372ea991b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/25/456925/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

For information about commands to use with Cells v2, see the man page for :ref:`man-page-cells-v2`.
deleted_lines: The nova-cells service handles communication between cells and selects cells for new instances.

commit_message:
Use new OpenStack logo and header

- Inserts Log In at end of header menu.
- Ensures there's a matching vertical line before the search box.
- Removes svg files, because the original logos are managed at
  www.openstack.org and copied to docs.openstack.org.

Co-Authored-By: Ian Y. Choi <ianyrchoi@gmail.com>
Partial-bug: #1646478

Change-Id: I63bdc6ac6b27a6aa10f0291bc38233c6254af87a

commit_message:
Allow router related functions to receive an ID

Add support for receiving an id as the argument for some router related
functions in the network proxy class.

Change-Id: Id80685bd4721f6ed12e5535fe0c6d49ecf10e135
Closes-Bug: 1683787

commit_message:
VStorage: fixed permissions on shares config file

* Shares config file may contain cluster password,
  thus we need to set correct permissions on that.
* manage_package option is introduced.
* Don't ensure, that log directory exists. Log
  directory is created when vstorage-client rpm
  is installed.

Change-Id: I1a84f106ab2fb40615f447021adc991349b86adf
Signed-off-by: Pavel Glushchak <pglushchak@virtuozzo.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-cinder refs/changes/07/458507/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # [*manage_package*] # (optional) Ensures VStorage client package is installed if true. # Defaults to: false # $manage_package = false, if $manage_package { package { 'vstorage-client': ensure => present, tag => 'cinder-support-package', } owner => 'root', group => 'cinder', mode => '640', ensure_resource('file', '/var/log/pstorage', { ensure => 'directory' })

subject: Don't escape /s in make_url query strings
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-04-06 22:29:21.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/hot/functions.py', 'heat/tests/test_hot.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/heat/commit/adffed9273ee680750de8985506b4227c50033bc', 'message': 'Don't escape /s in make_url query strings

Query strings are not _required_ to have slashes escaped, and in fact RFC
3986 suggests that "it is sometimes better for usability to avoid
percent-escaping those characters" (Section 3.4).

TripleO is currently unable to use the make_url function because its
database URLs contain slashes in the query, and end up in config files that
don't allow percent characters. This is probably not going to be an
isolated occurrence, so don't escape slashes in the query string.

Change-Id: I72f84e737b042ecfaabf5639c6164d46a072b423
'}]
commit_message:
Don't escape /s in make_url query strings

Query strings are not _required_ to have slashes escaped, and in fact RFC
3986 suggests that "it is sometimes better for usability to avoid
percent-escaping those characters" (Section 3.4).

TripleO is currently unable to use the make_url function because its
database URLs contain slashes in the query, and end up in config files that
don't allow percent characters. This is probably not going to be an
isolated occurrence, so don't escape slashes in the query string.

Change-Id: I72f84e737b042ecfaabf5639c6164d46a072b423
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/74/454374/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

Make wait_for path smart

This way it isn't necessary to set TRIPLEO_ROOT when running
tripleo.sh locally.

commit_message:
Replace six.iteritems() with .items()

1.As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using
six.iteritems to achieve iterators. We can
use dict.items instead, as it will return
iterators in PY3 as well. And dict.items/keys
will more readable. 2.In py2, the performance
about list should be negligible, see the link [2].
[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: I7c8f540eced0731f4dfb1dfd045828b5a9bb6c67

commit_message:
Fix wait_for path

The wait_for paths had assumptions around the base folder structure
which make it hard to consume outside of CI. This change fixes the
wait_for to use the SCRIPTS_DIR instead of assuming specific paths from
the TRIPLEO_ROOT.

Change-Id: I72994364914e891294db54e3557b47460261bf80
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ci refs/changes/02/436202/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if $($SCRIPTS_DIR/wait_for -w $OVERCLOUD_DELETE_TIMEOUT -d 10 -s "DELETE_COMPLETE" -- "$wait_command"); then if $SCRIPTS_DIR/wait_for -w 300 -d 10 -s "Stack not found" -- "$wait_command"; then if $SCRIPTS_DIR/wait_for -w 300 -d 10 -s "CREATE_COMPLETE" -f "CREATE_FAILED" -- $WAIT_FOR_COMMAND; then if $SCRIPTS_DIR/wait_for -w 360 -d 10 -s "bytes from $vm1_ip" -- "ping -c 1 $vm1_ip" ; then
deleted_lines: if $($TRIPLEO_ROOT/tripleo-ci/scripts/wait_for -w $OVERCLOUD_DELETE_TIMEOUT -d 10 -s "DELETE_COMPLETE" -- "$wait_command"); then if $TRIPLEO_ROOT/tripleo-ci/scripts/wait_for -w 300 -d 10 -s "Stack not found" -- "$wait_command"; then if $TRIPLEO_ROOT/tripleo-ci/scripts/wait_for -w 300 -d 10 -s "CREATE_COMPLETE" -f "CREATE_FAILED" -- $WAIT_FOR_COMMAND; then if $TRIPLEO_ROOT/tripleo-ci/scripts/wait_for -w 360 -d 10 -s "bytes from $vm1_ip" -- "ping -c 1 $vm1_ip" ; then

commit_message:
Use KeystoneAuth1 Plugins

Changes the entrypoint namespace to the namespce for
keystoneauth plugins. Since the plugin names were, for
the most part identical, attempts to use the
python-openstackclient would appear to be using
the KSA plugins, but were actually using the KSC versions.

This breaks quite a few test.  Those test have beeen removed

The KSC plugs in have been left, as have the entrypoints.  These
can be removed in a later commit.

Change-Id: Id8cd669a02e2f454859b90278c24639586c89f6a
Closes-Bug: #1621926

commit_message:
Federation support

Change-Id: I31082b78f49fa18ee536ea6fdee2012b0fadf7a1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-specs refs/changes/40/279840/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ================== Federation Support ================== Include the URL of your launchpad blueprint: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/tripleo Identity Provider, Mapping, and Protocol support for Keystone Federation Problem Description =================== Adding Federation Support to Keystone requires orchestration. A prerequisite for this was Apache running in HTTPD, which is now a reality. The operator needs to modify the Apache HTTPD instance running Keystone so that it can act as a service provider that integrated with an Identity Provider exposing SAML. The next step is to configure that instance to know about an IdP. There are two major pieces to setting up Keystone this way. The first is the Remote API calls to Keystone to create the database records for the Federation objects. The second is the configuration of the Apache instance. Proposed Change =============== Overview -------- Add puppet module support for adding a new identity provider, mapping and protocol, to include the Apache HTTPD configuration. Add support to the Heat stack ofr Tripleo to add each of the Federation IdPs and maintain them over the lifespan of the overcloud. Alternatives ------------ Manual configuration of the Federation providers is possible, but any changes that touch Puppet managed files are going to be overwritte, so it is possible that there is no alternative. Security Impact --------------- Federation will cahnge the security profile of the Keysteon server, but iun ways that have already been identitifed and managed within th Keystone project. Other End User Impact --------------------- This will allow users with acredentials in externai identity providers work with OpenStack. It will simplify the workflow for cloud administratrors. Performance Impact ------------------ When adding an IdOP, it is likely that we will need to restart hte HTTPD instant that manages Keystone. This should have a negligible impact due to load balanceing/HA proxy. Other Deployer Impact --------------------- All configuration will be managed inside the Puppet manifests and Hiera data. THis cahnge will take effect immediately after the Federated IdP is added to Keystone. Developer Impact ---------------- This should have minimal additional developer impact. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Adam Young ayoung ayoung@redhat.com John Dennis jdennis jdennis@redhat.com Work Items ---------- -- Fix the existing Keystone puppet modules for adding federation -- Add the heat templates for adding a an IdP. Dependencies ============ The only dependency was HTTPD support for Keystone, which has merged. Testing ======= To test the feature, We will set up an IdP (most likely Keycloak) and run the integration against that. The Keycloak IdP will have several pre-cannedd users that we will then use to log in to Keystone, get tokens, and perform basic workloads on other remote services. Documentation Impact ==================== Document how to call and how to debug this feature. References ========== Keystone Federation API: http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/keystone-specs/tree/api/v3/identity-api-v3-os-federation-ext.rst Keystone Configuration documentation for Federation: http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/keystone/tree/doc/source/configure_federation.rst

commit_message:
Fix return code when failing before launching the stack

Until now when a configuration error was detected early during the
pre-deployment verifications, the command would correctly return before
attempting to create/update the Heat stack, however the return code
would still show as '0', preventing scripts from picking up the
problem.

Change-Id: I8bd16e9753618e4c234440d7a6626e0ce4bd9972
Closes-Bug: #1672790
(cherry picked from commit 28051613c9c1c5231140981fca76fa704af55d5d)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-tripleoclient refs/changes/34/452634/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: raise exceptions.InvalidConfiguration() raise exceptions.InvalidConfiguration()

Depends-On: I789c960f61a30ccd4b076fcae4b3e1b80e825585

Change-Id: Ibedca0d80f93ab5e4bf7f105472bb384bc9506e6

added_lines: class ExportPlan(command.Command): """Export a deployment plan""" log = logging.getLogger(__name__ + ".ExportPlan") def get_parser(self, prog_name): parser = super(ExportPlan, self).get_parser(prog_name) parser.add_argument('plans', metavar='<name>', nargs="+", help=_('Name of the plan(s) to export')) return parser def take_action(self, parsed_args): self.log.debug("take_action(%s)" % parsed_args) workflow_client = self.app.client_manager.workflow_engine for plan in parsed_args.plans: print("Exporting plan %s..." % plan) plan_management.export_deployment_plan(workflow_client, container=plan)

commit_message:
Move unit tests for list networks to test_network.py file

This file is place where all tests related to networks
lives so tests for list_networks should be also there.

Change-Id: I3aa7254f66a100d269deefef725dff036488efd2

commit_message:
Stop DHCP agent scheduler warnings in UTs

This prevents all of the warnings in unit tests about
no DHCP agents being available for scheduling during
network and port creation.

TrivialFix
Change-Id: I06cb626496866b90f60b406d1141ecad6e1a47e1

commit_message:
Add futurist to requirements.txt explicitly

After commit df194c8b4c25c6128f03a98fd0e628ba14b743ff we use
futurist library in horizon code. futurist is already installed
by dependency of oslo.messaging required osprofiler, but it is
better to declare our dependency explicitly rather than depending
on requirements of other library.

Also this commit fixes import grouping related to futurist.

Change-Id: I260b4ea88a5a41808286026815f519693740961b

commit_message:
Fix doc generation for Python3

Fix the Sphinx html_last_updated_fmt for Python3.
The html_last_updated_fmt option is interpeted as a
byte string in python3, causing Sphinx build to break.
This patch makes it utf-8 string.

Change-Id: I6e940404bb7109249257d2adf6aed0a71d7bed72
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/murano refs/changes/26/457226/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Fix doc generation for Python3

Fix the Sphinx html_last_updated_fmt for Python3.
The html_last_updated_fmt option is interpeted as a
byte string in python3, causing Sphinx build to break.
This patch makes it utf-8 string.

Change-Id: If22500e42b43f92c44cc2742d946b04a9d6c982f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/murano-agent refs/changes/28/457228/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: html_last_updated_fmt = subprocess.check_output(git_cmd).decode('utf-8')

commit_message:
Adding bandit.yaml configuration to bandit

Per change in [0], it is better to whitelist or blacklist bandit rules
via a bandit configuration file [1] rather than continually modifying
tox.ini's parameter list.

[0] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/456370/
[1] https://docs.openstack.org/developer/bandit/config.html

Change-Id: I3a4e1e947470de6d712de5e663c9a2f7d7c242c0

commit_message:
Add mising timeout to ApplicationCatalogClient

Requests made by tests using this client were not specifiying a timeout,
causing them to appear to hang indefinitely when there's a problem.

Change-Id: Ibcbe7a4af8566339c68265c11df9a09ebbe7f6ca

commit_message:
Add `nosec` for Bandit issue 506 in resource_manager.py

Running `tox -e bandit` will raise a `B506: Use of unsafe yaml load`
issue. Because yaml.safe_load is a wrapper for yaml.load(SafeLoader),
this is a non-issue raised by the tests. This patch adds a `nosec` to
ignore the issue and comments to explain why it is okay as is.

Change-Id: I4bb3b1635000a8bf77015f35f0be36df2c4f731f

commit_message:
Make murano auth with murano_auth section instend of keystone_authtoken

This patch add a murano_auth for murano auth with keystone,
This gives ability to fine-tune role-based privileges for
service-user going to execute trust-delegated tasks and the auth
configuration properties do not need to change when keystonemiddleware
deprecates its configuration properties.

Closes-Bug: #1643583
Closes-Bug: #1658648
Change-Id: If10fa8c938c264c7b5cadb3c3ed77f39488dcab7

commit_message:
Include two transitive dependencies to work around conflicts

For people installing released shade from pip and then trying to use it
somehow through entrypoints, 1.20.0 is currently broken because of some
transitive dependencies, ordering issues and conflicting exclusion
ranges.

While this is by no means a comprehensive or sustainable solution to the
problem, it does unbreak the end users currently broken and is not
terribly onerous. Both of these additions are tracked in g-r and both
can be removed when the dependencies that pull in conflicting ranges of
things are removed.

Change-Id: I6a4a1ab5ab109f0650873201868e0f1c4d09c564
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/shade refs/changes/75/458875/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- fixes: - Added requests and Babel to the direct dependencies list to work around issues with pip installation, entrypoints and transitive dependencies with conflicting exclusion ranges. Packagers of shade do not need to add these two new requirements to shade's dependency list - they are transitive depends and should be satisfied by the other things in the requirements list. Both will be removed from the list again once the python client libraries that pull them in have been removed.

commit_message:
Move wsgi-intercept to test-requirements.txt

The wsgi-intercept dependency is only used in the functional
tests for the placement API, so we should move it to the
test-requirements.txt file so people don't try to package
it for runtime installs.

Change-Id: I0d8325e12ed7d5d022877782d6aa4ba4055c30db
Closes-Bug: #1625653
(cherry picked from commit d3dfeb44d649a8e100ee4ce91468086cfebd9ab6)

commit_message:
Skip tags if running on OpenStack Infra

For periodic upgrade testing from Newton to Ocata, the DEPLOY_AIO
variable was removed in Ic5c60c7f29ead048599d5c64cfbd08fbf7f9e480 so
these tags were not being skipped as expected.

Check for the existence of /etc/nodepool instead to determine if the
script is being run on OpenStack Infra.

Change-Id: I6407b9effc500bb80062ef4700ea5b3e34cbfef3

commit_message:
Install netcat for libvirt live migration

Libvirt live migration requires netcat. It appears that newer UCA
packages may not automagically pull this in so explicitly list it as a
dependency of nova compute here. Note that netcat/netcat-traditional do
not appear to work and netcat-openbsd is required.

Change-Id: If2dbc53d082fea779448998ea12b821bd037a14e
(cherry picked from commit 3d4c6d2dd16280de150b462ae51ccf85a932c7c1)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/92/458592/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: netcat-openbsd

commit_message:
Rename user stories related repos

The Product Working Group has decided to cease using the term "user
stories" in favor of "development proposals" and to realign the
"userstory-dashboard" with the "featuretracker" name used for the
site where it's hosted. As a result, rename the following three Git
repositories:

  * openstack-infra/puppet-userstory_dashboard -> puppet-featuretracker

  * openstack-infra/userstory-dashboard -> featuretracker

  * openstack/openstack-user-stories -> development-proposals

See
http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/product_working_group/2017/product_working_group.2017-04-03-21.06.log.html#l-93
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/user-committee/2017-March/001902.html
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/user-committee/2017-April/001919.html
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/user-committee/2017-April/001929.html

Change-Id: I3791f909e57a0b4f9211681e7e0faf9d539ca321
Needed-By: Id6bb1a26da2b2f39ae5d1ce017062a13f1afc135

commit_message:
Rename DefCore Committee -> Interop WG

At the Board of Directors meeting on April 24, 2016 the Board of
Directors indicated that as DefCore has evolved it's focus on
interoperability and it's working structure, it's name may be a source
of some confusion to those outside of the community or who are new to
the community.  The Board made an informal request that the DefCore
Committee consider changing it's name to more clearly reflect it's focus
and structure.  In August of 2016, the Board passed a resolution
renaming the group to "The Interop Working Group".[1]

Since then, the Interop Working Group has completed a series of changes
to it's documentation and public resources to reflect it's new name. [2]
The next step in the process is to rename the project's resources in
infra, including it's git repository and associated artifacts.  This
commit renames the appropriate resources as per the system-config
documentation.[3]

[1]
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Governance/Foundation/23Aug2016BoardMinutes
[2] For example:
http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/defcore/commit/?id=d8fb682a2bd17c111f5dd4f8341fb1b300ac2d4d
[3]
http://docs.openstack.org/infra/system-config/gerrit.html#renaming-a-project

Change-Id: I949e17351ce5f9ea5f12120c2599d725eda6dcc1

commit_message:
Add redfish driver

This patch is adding a redfish driver based on the sushy library. This
is just a basic driver that currently supports:

* Power: Hard power on/off/reboot, soft power off/reboot
* Management: Setting the boot device (PXE, disk, cd-rom and bios)
              and its frequency (persistent or not)
* Management: NMI Injection
* SSL authentication

Unittest coverage for the redfish modules is now in 100%, let's try to
keep it this way (-:

Documentation and DevStack updates will be done on subsequent patches.

Partial-Bug: #1526477
Change-Id: I14470edff65cd14bb73263ec7310559a8eaa6c84
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/82/438982/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: redfish = ironic.drivers.modules.redfish.management:RedfishManagement redfish = ironic.drivers.modules.redfish.power:RedfishPower redfish = ironic.drivers.redfish:RedfishHardware

'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2017-03-30 21:58:45.000000000', 'files': ['specs/pike/converge-api-extensions-across-cluster.rst'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron-specs/commit/43af5b3fc502085fa7d011c630dabc920af1cb0e', 'message': 'Converge /extensions API to common subset across cluster

Change-Id: I43ca3fa115bae2fcc608e4ed3539c2abca315054

commit_message:
Converge /extensions API to common subset across cluster

Change-Id: I43ca3fa115bae2fcc608e4ed3539c2abca315054
Related-Bug: #1672852
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-specs refs/changes/93/451993/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ======================================================== Converge list of supported extensions across controllers ======================================================== https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1672852 Problem Description =================== Since Ocata, we can upgrade controllers in rolling mode, where cluster is comprised of different major versions of neutron-server (N and N+1). In this situation, API requests issued by users may land any of controllers, and if controllers expose different extensions, cloud aware app behaviour may depend on the order of controllers picked by round robin load balancer. Even if an affinity aware load balancer is used, same cloud aware app run may depend on which controller the initial request fetching the list of supported extensions via /extensions/ API will land. Another issue with the current behaviour is when clients hitting a controller of newer version create / modify resources using new features, introducing data in database that may not be easily or safely interpreted by older controllers. It is exaggerated by the fact that Neutron API is consumed programmatically, including by other components like Nova, which makes it impossible to hold on requests using new API for the time while upgrade is happening. The proposal here is to introduce a concept of cluster awareness into controller service, where neutron-servers will know about all other controllers and their lists of supported extensions, and will avoid exposing anything that is not supported by all other controllers. In effect, during upgrade, newer controllers will not advertise support for newly added extensions until all controllers are at the newer version. This will make sure that no requests utilizing new features and producing hard to interpret data in database will be served until cluster of neutron-servers is fully upgraded. Glossary ======== * Supported extension. This is an extension that a Neutron implementation is technically capable of serving. * Advertised extension. This is an extension that a Neutron implementation will advertise via /extensions/ API. In non-upgrade scenario, all supported extensions will be advertised. In upgrade scenario, some of supported extensions may be not advertised (but not vice versa). Proposed Change =============== To implement the proposal, we will introduce a new servers table similar to agents table that will contain information about all controllers, and will be populated by them on startup. The information in the table will include list of supported extensions for each controller. On startup, neutron-server will: * populate the table with information about itself (including the list of supported extensions as currently calculated for /extensions/ API). * inspect all the records in the table, calculating the list of extensions to advertise. * load and expose via /extensions API those extensions that should be advertised. The algorithm to calculate the list of extensions to advertise is: take all supported extensions for all controllers, including itself, and calculate the largest common subset of extensions. This will make all new servers starting during upgrade to see that there are other controllers still running with a shorter list of extensions, and to not serve / expose extensions added in the newer release. Example of calculation: let's say there is a server1 with the following list of supported extensions: [A, B, C, D], and server2 with [A, B, C, D, E]. In that case, when server2 is started, it will calculate the common subset which is [A, B, C, D], that will be loaded / exposed in API. The E extension will need to wait until server1 is upgraded and gets [A, B, C, D, E] too, at which point it can start advertising the whole [A, B, C, D, E] list. Now, when the whole controller cluster is upgraded, neutron-servers will need a signal to reload. We could implement that with a periodic thread checking the table for changes, triggering recalculation on each update. But since operators may want to avoid exposure of new extensions for some more time until they are ready, the proposal here is to instead assume that operators will restart all controllers (in rolling mode) after full upgrade to catch up with the changes in the servers table. .. note:: This will make all new servers starting during upgrade to see that there are other controllers still running with a shorter list of extensions, and to not serve / expose extensions added in the newer release. Alternatives ============ The easiest alternative is not doing anything, and we should not disregard it lightly, since the proposal introduces new points of complexity. We may try to solve potential data interpretation issues programmatically, and leaving operators with the requirement to use affinity aware load balancer (which seems to be the common practice of the day). It's not clear if we will be able to handle all interpretation issues we may face without horrible hacks, if not refusing evolving the code base. Another alternative is instead guarding new features with flags (disabled by default) for initial release introducing them. This will effectively disable new extensions for controllers using newer versions until operators opt in them modifying configuration files, or till the next upgrade that flips the default value for the new guarding option to True happens, at which point we should not have any controllers running older releases anyway. The issue with this alternative is that this complicates configuration for operators that want to opt in new features, and will complicate deployment logic. The benefit here would be avoiding self-awareness complexity proposed here. As a variant of the latest alternative, we could introduce a global switch that would enable new features, that would effectively rely on some form of version pinning for Neutron API. The issue here is that we don't have any versioning schema for Neutron API right now, and it's not clear if we are able to come up with one due to API pluggability. That being said, I would be happy to see us explore the topic. References ==========

commit_message:
Add service config settings to agent services

When containerizing ceilometer agents, keystone auth is not getting
set correctly as we're not including the service config settings.

Change-Id: Ic17d64eb39e1fcb64c198410f27adbe94c84b7d4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/85/456385/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: service_config_settings: get_attr: [CeilometerServiceBase, role_data, service_config_settings]

commit_message:
Move ceilometer upgrade re-run out of collector

Since collector is deprecated, lets move this out of collector.pp
so it gets run and resource types are created appropriately even
when collector is not included.

Closes-bug: #1676961

Change-Id: I32445a891c34f519ab16dcecc81993f8909f6481
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tripleo refs/changes/36/458036/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Run ceilometer-upgrade in step 5 so gnocchi resource types # are created safely. if $step >= 5 { exec {'ceilometer-db-upgrade': command => 'ceilometer-upgrade --skip-metering-database', path => ['/usr/bin', '/usr/sbin'], } }

commit_message:
Remove install_resolv_conf from dib puppet script

This parameter is used for the unbound class, but we moved that class
out of openstack_project::template class and started managing unbound
here in the project-config dib elements, so we don't need to keep using
it and leaving it unset will not change any behavior.

Change-Id: I2ed1610dbfdc131943c64745e79da75133bf6818

subject: Container drive error results double space usage on rest drives
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-04-12 07:27:08.000000000', 'files': ['test/unit/common/test_db_replicator.py', 'swift/common/db_replicator.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/1582f8a559ac03be7d3976558e66339d8c3a1811', 'message': 'Container drive error results double space usage on rest drives

When drive with container or account database is unmounted
replicator pushes database to handoff location. But this
handoff location finds replica with unmounted drive and
pushes database to the *next* handoff until all handoffs has
a replica - all container/account servers has replicas of
all unmounted drives.

This patch solves:
- Consumption of iterator on handoff location that results in
  replication to the next and next handoff.
- StopIteration exception stopped not finished loop over
  available handoffs if no more nodes exists for db replication
  candidency.

Regression was introduced in 2.4.0 with rsync compression.

Co-Author: Kota Tsuyuzaki <tsuyuzaki.kota@lab.ntt.co.jp>

Change-Id: I344f9daaa038c6946be11e1cf8c4ef104a09e68b
Closes-Bug: 1675500
'}]
commit_message:
Container drive error results double space usage on rest drives

When drive with container or account database is unmounted
replicator pushes database to handoff location. But this
handoff location finds replica with unmounted drive and
pushes database to the *next* handoff until all handoffs has
a replica - all container/account servers has replicas of
all unmounted drives.

This patch solves:
- Consumption of iterator on handoff location that results in
  replication to the next and next handoff.
- StopIteration exception stopped not finished loop over
  available handoffs if no more nodes exists for db replication
  candidency.

Regression was introduced in 2.4.0 with rsync compression.

Co-Author: Kota Tsuyuzaki <tsuyuzaki.kota@lab.ntt.co.jp>

Change-Id: I344f9daaa038c6946be11e1cf8c4ef104a09e68b
Closes-Bug: 1675500
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/95/456095/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: for node in self.ring.get_more_nodes(int(partition)): try: repl_nodes.append(next(more_nodes)) except StopIteration: self.logger.error( _('ERROR There are not enough handoff nodes to reach ' 'replica count for partition %s'), partition)

commit_message:
Add 'connection_info' to attachment object

There are some issues around new attach/detach API/CLI,
fix them step by step. This patch added attribute
'connection_info' to attachment object, also add related
testcases in API unit testcases.

Depends-On: 87982a56771cf66f6ae4beec92e4de9d27388fc9
Closes-Bug: #1681297

Change-Id: Idbc1049e8adf1d5b955bda01d58bb6b89fc6c5c7

commit_message:
Remove python-openstackclient from requirements

I'm sure there's probably a long discussion about this already that I've
forgotten about - but now that osc-lib is in place and in use,
ironicclient doesn't need to actually depend on python-openstackclient.
Depending on it pulls in a phone book of other dependencies that are not
actually needed by people who are using the library in their
applications and can make transitive dependency chains much more
fragile.

It's possible though that it was left in for a reason, so if so and if
this has already been beaten to death - sorry.

Change-Id: I0876521f0e8541cb77d6485ffdeffabb21ac6f58
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-ironicclient refs/changes/73/458873/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Deprecate rally.osclients.EC2

We do not have any plugin which use it and we do not have any gate
which checks that rally.osclients.EC2 even work.

Let's deprecate it and remove it in future.

Change-Id: I554b972e5ea1f0b5a28d6cbcd1b110b451d428af

subject: fullstack: Don't let dhcp agents failover
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-04-11 17:44:38.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/4a31e16be7e23b0910e5fb544bb393e8802bbb2f', 'message': 'fullstack: Don't let dhcp agents failover

It turned out dhcp tests work only because agents are considered dead
after 10 seconds while they report to server every 60 seconds. This led
to calling network resync after agent revival and hiding the fact dhcp
agent is not capable of receiving any amqp messages.

This patch sets the report interval of agents to the half of
agent_down_time on server side and uses eventlet dhcp agent in order to
trigger eventlet monkey patching code.

Eventlet was behind the failure with messages not getting processed. As
[1] notes: "Note: If the eventlet executor is used, the threading and
time library need to be monkeypatched."

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.messaging/server.html

Related-bug: 1453350

Change-Id: I0336176b9c364fe3a95be5cef9e7a3af1ef9d7e9
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2017-04-12 09:33:15.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/25175493aaec00952be8c6ab409b7370570e6f1b', 'message': 'fullstack: Don't let dhcp agents failover

It turned out dhcp tests work only because agents are considered dead
after 10 seconds while they report to server every 60 seconds. This led
to calling network resync after agent revival and hiding the fact dhcp
agent is not capable of receiving any amqp messages.

This patch sets the report interval of agents to the half of
agent_down_time on server side and uses eventlet dhcp agent in order to
trigger eventlet monkey patching code.

Eventlet was behind the failure with messages not getting processed. As
[1] notes: "Note: If the eventlet executor is used, the threading and
time library need to be monkeypatched."

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.messaging/server.html

Related-bug: 1453350

Change-Id: I0336176b9c364fe3a95be5cef9e7a3af1ef9d7e9
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2017-04-12 09:39:59.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/95a70bf746df58760d86030b14e4e2e8dee45d6b', 'message': 'fullstack: Don't let dhcp agents failover

It turned out dhcp tests work only because agents are considered dead
after 10 seconds while they report to server every 60 seconds. This led
to calling network resync after agent revival and hiding the fact dhcp
agent is not capable of receiving any amqp messages.

This patch sets the report interval of agents to the half of
agent_down_time on server side and uses eventlet dhcp agent in order to
trigger eventlet monkey patching code.

Eventlet was behind the failure with messages not getting processed. As
[1] notes: "Note: If the eventlet executor is used, the threading and
time library need to be monkeypatched."

Because test uses dhclient to obtain ip address from dhcp server it also
overwrites /etc/resolv.conf. Because this file is not isolated per test,
the file is set immutable for the test runtime.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.messaging/server.html

commit_message:
fullstack: Don't let dhcp agents failover

It turned out dhcp tests work only because agents are considered dead
after 10 seconds while they report to server every 60 seconds. This led
to calling network resync after agent revival and hiding the fact dhcp
agent is not capable of receiving any amqp messages.

This patch sets the report interval of agents to the half of
agent_down_time on server side and uses eventlet dhcp agent in order to
trigger eventlet monkey patching code.

Eventlet was behind the failure with messages not getting processed. As
[1] notes: "Note: If the eventlet executor is used, the threading and
time library need to be monkeypatched."

Because each port calls dhclient to obtain IP address and each dhclient
instance overwrites /etc/resolv.conf there was added a script that
generates fullstack-dhclient-script from an existing dhclient-script
before starting fulltstack tests. This generated script is passed to
each dhclient process running in fake fullstack machine using -sf
parameter.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.messaging/server.html

Related-bug: 1453350

Change-Id: I0336176b9c364fe3a95be5cef9e7a3af1ef9d7e9

commit_message:
Update SUSE distro information in install guide

SUSE tests their OpenStack packages on openSUSE Leap 42.2 and SLES 12
SP2, so this patch updates the install guide to address those newer
releases.

Change-Id: I9b823900a1562485b8d0fd96c4c1a8c0b248f13f

deleted_lines: for openSUSE Leap 42.1 and SUSE Linux Enterprise Server 12 SP1.

commit_message:
Fix mitaka online migration for PCI devices

Currently, a validation error is thrown if we find any PCI device
records which have not populated the parent_addr column on a nova
upgrade. However, the only PCI records for which a parent_addr
makes sense for are those with a device type of 'type-VF' (ie. an
SRIOV virtual function).  PCI records with a device type of 'type-PF'
or 'type-PCI' will not have a parent_addr.  If any of those records
are present on upgrade, the validation will fail.

This change checks that the device type of the PCI record is
'type-VF' when making sure the parent_addr has been correctly
populated

Closes-Bug: #1680918
Change-Id: Ia7e773674a4976fc03deee3f08a6ddb45568ec11
(cherry picked from commit 7f3f0ef1fbb51f6f17d2c13840e0f98d17fa9093)
(cherry picked from commit c23c5e9f747e7127497dfd77ca0b33df2be74a2d)

keystoneauth is the library that pulls in requests. If we have client
libraries also depend directly on requests, we can get into situations

commit_message:
Remove direct dependency on requests

keystoneauth is the library that pulls in requests. If we have client
libraries also depend directly on requests, we can get into situations
for end users in installations where, because of sequencing of client
library releases there are conflicting versions of requests needed and
pkg_resources/entrypoints break.

Remove the direct depend and let keystoneauth pull it in for us.

Change-Id: I76fe89f9c166e61971b5c116c7f01fbd5ccb5cf7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-novaclient refs/changes/68/458868/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Workflow to select nodes matching a profile/role

As a first step to enabling parameter calculation based on introspection
data, we'll need to find the available nodes matching a particular role
(which is associated with a flavor, which matches a specific profile in
ironic).

The next step is to retrieve the introspection data for each node output
from this workflow, then define another workflow that does the
transformation between introspection data and parameters.

Partially-Implements: blueprint tripleo-derive-parameters
Change-Id: I4b13f2923caa055be979eda57f9d5009960d61ef

commit_message:
Fix atomic wrapper

If raw data is old format, we need to convert to new
format, and specify the starting time with 0.
1.move out `rally task results` to cli module
2.port _test_atomic_action_timer to wrapper

Afert porting report to new atomic format,we will
move convert_atomic_actions to wrapper too.

Change-Id: I6f42d7a9272673dccea8770c83b7084a2c9503d4

added_lines: def __init__(self, atomic_actions): if isinstance(atomic_actions, list): self.__atomic_actions = atomic_actions self.__old_atomic_actions = objects.Task.convert_atomic_actions( self.__atomic_actions) else: self.__atomic_actions = self._convert_old_atomic_actions( atomic_actions) self.__old_atomic_actions = atomic_actions super(WrapperForAtomicActions, self).__init__(self.__atomic_actions) def _convert_old_atomic_actions(self, old_atomic_actions): atomic_actions = [] for name, duration in old_atomic_actions.items(): atomic_actions.append({"name": name, "started_at": 0, "finished_at": duration, "children": []}) return atomic_actions
deleted_lines: LOG_INFO = "Atomic actions format is changed. It is a list now." def __init__(self, atomic_actions): super(WrapperForAtomicActions, self).__init__(atomic_actions) self.__atomic_actions = atomic_actions self.__old_atomic_actions = objects.Task.convert_atomic_actions( self.__atomic_actions) LOG.warning(self.LOG_INFO) LOG.warning(self.LOG_INFO) LOG.warning(self.LOG_INFO)

commit_message:
Create heat-specific patrole gate

Creates a heat-specific patrole gate, because heat's policy.json
uses different roles than most projects: heat_stack_user, in
particular. Two gates will be added:
  - admin heat non-voting gate
  - heat_stack_user heat non-voting gate

This patch updates the post_test_hook to only execute heat
patrole tests if the second argument passed to the script
is "heat".

Change-Id: I6e9f909e4be5e0be94e910f3a1b0eb22bb74ee38
Depends-On: I05a53ce80453b7488233bf765951837a3d86209f

added_lines: DEVSTACK_GATE_TEMPEST_HEAT_REGEX="(?!.*\[.*\bslow\b.*\])(^patrole_tempest_plugin\.tests\.api\.orchestration)"function set_uuid_tokens() { # Use uuid tokens for faster test runs KEYSTONE_CONF=/etc/keystone/keystone.conf iniset $KEYSTONE_CONF token provider uuid sudo service apache2 restart } function setup_config() { # Set enable_rbac=True under [rbac] section in tempest.conf iniset $TEMPEST_CONFIG rbac enable_rbac True # Set rbac_test_role=$RBAC_ROLE under [rbac] section in tempest.conf iniset $TEMPEST_CONFIG rbac rbac_test_role $RBAC_ROLE # Set strict_policy_check=False under [rbac] section in tempest.conf iniset $TEMPEST_CONFIG rbac strict_policy_check False # Set additional, necessary CONF values iniset $TEMPEST_CONFIG auth use_dynamic_credentials True iniset $TEMPEST_CONFIG auth tempest_roles Member iniset $TEMPEST_CONFIG identity auth_version v3 } function run_tests() { # Give permissions back to Tempest. sudo chown -R tempest:stack $BASE/new/tempest sudo chown -R tempest:stack $BASE/data/tempest set -o errexit # cd into Tempest directory before executing tox. cd $BASE/new/tempest if [[ "$TYPE" == "multinode" ]]; then $TEMPEST_COMMAND -eall-plugin -- $DEVSTACK_MULTINODE_GATE_TEMPEST_REGEX --concurrency=$TEMPEST_CONCURRENCY elif [[ "$TYPE" == "heat" ]]; then $TEMPEST_COMMAND -eall-plugin -- $DEVSTACK_GATE_TEMPEST_HEAT_REGEX --concurrency=$TEMPEST_CONCURRENCY else $TEMPEST_COMMAND -eall-plugin -- $DEVSTACK_GATE_TEMPEST_REGEX --concurrency=$TEMPEST_CONCURRENCY fi sudo -H -u tempest .tox/all-plugin/bin/tempest list-plugins } set_uuid_tokens setup_config run_tests

commit_message:
Update all SHAs for 13.3.19

This patch updates all the roles to the latest available stable
SHA's, copies the release notes from the updated roles into the
integrated repo, updates all the OpenStack Service SHA's, and
updates the appropriate python requirements pins.

Change-Id: I16fef88e0914e454fc6e24b7243543956dabb810
Depends-On: Ia2b6746790b12912c6dd8b75936470cdc4ca07d6

on scenario004 and one of its tempest test.

commit_message:
Make 'reauthentication_auth_method=trusts' the default

When overcloud deployments take more time than
the token expiration time set in keystone, this
default in undercloud would allow for deployment
to continue till timeout.

Depends-on: I247b02a50bb46ce16ca120961dd9c3df3e6026fd

Change-Id: Ifa2aa352482786d9f015f85352820c27f2128e64
Closes-Bug: #1683983

commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/newton

Not sure why this wasn't done when the u-c were introduced back in
I8be883215f27abb58d15b85e8542cbdf32000bac , but without this unit
tests currently fail due to a newer version of keystoneauth1.

Change-Id: I0dbeb2ff057c0f6bf00d27d4f1e2662e59d046bc

commit_message:
Change auth_version to v3 on Tempest

Keystone v3 API is CURRENT and the v2 API is deprecated now.
So we need to change the default config of auth_version to fit
for current API status.

Change-Id: I801e6740258ddea2a1b628a209970e0307d39d12
(cherry picked from commit dc6e55021861afceae2a7778b299df94ceab0a6e)

deleted_lines: if [ "$ENABLE_IDENTITY_V2" == "False" ]; then # Only Identity v3 is available; then skip Identity API v2 tests iniset $TEMPEST_CONFIG identity-feature-enabled api_v2 False # In addition, use v3 auth tokens for running all Tempest tests iniset $TEMPEST_CONFIG identity auth_version v3 iniset $TEMPEST_CONFIG identity auth_version ${TEMPEST_AUTH_VERSION:-v2}

subject: Add sphinxcontrib-actdiag & sphinxcontrib-netdiag
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-04-14 20:08:22.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt', 'upper-constraints.txt'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/requirements/commit/e2503512c240b75e4e771e97f96e43bf753b1390', 'message': 'Add sphinxcontrib-actdiag & sphinxcontrib-netdiag

These allow incorporating activity and network diagrams
written in markup nd rendered as images to be easily
incorporated into rst documents.

We will use these alongside the corresponding packages
for block diagrams and sequence diagrams in the manila
development reference documents, as proposed here [1].

sphinxcontrib-blockdiag and sphinxcontrib-seqdiag from the
same parent project are already dependencies so presumably
adding these should not be controversial.

Change-Id: I05f6c0e4c3256606d39f1128f238155ad3b843f2
'}]
commit_message:
Add sphinxcontrib-actdiag & sphinxcontrib-netdiag

These allow incorporating activity and network diagrams
written in markup nd rendered as images to be easily
incorporated into rst documents.

We will use these alongside the corresponding packages
for block diagrams and sequence diagrams in the manila
development reference documents, as proposed here [1].

sphinxcontrib-blockdiag and sphinxcontrib-seqdiag from the
same parent project are already dependencies so presumably
adding these should not be controversial.

[1] Ic7782ea0642f7a5912f397376948b45ac134604d

Change-Id: I05f6c0e4c3256606d39f1128f238155ad3b843f2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/requirements refs/changes/53/456953/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: sphinxcontrib-actdiag===0.8.5 sphinxcontrib-nwdiag===0.9.5 actdiag===0.5.4 nwdiag===1.0.4

subject: Neutron chart: fix oslo concurrency typo
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-04-21 13:51:00.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/values.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-helm/commit/0e3a8a8a78906619b70a6fc05d0fc029830ef5e0', 'message': 'Neutron chart: fix oslo concurrency typo

oslo_concurrency value was not correctly defined in neutron/values.yaml.

The template structure expects to have oslo_concurrency.oslo.concurrency
fields, while values.yaml had oslo_concurrency.oslo_concurrency fields.

Change-Id: I4930acf290093a5d8b43cf37171380207cecba6b
'}]
commit_message:
Neutron chart: fix oslo concurrency typo

oslo_concurrency value was not correctly defined in neutron/values.yaml.

The template structure expects to have oslo_concurrency.oslo.concurrency
fields, while values.yaml had oslo_concurrency.oslo_concurrency fields.

commit_message:
Uses Transaction from ovsdbapp

The Transaction class from the "ovsdb" module in Neutron has been moved
to the new ovsdbapp library, this patch is updating the code to use it.

Depends-On: I338ac59c9bb38ebddfa1d4b2059e9a13e604bf09
Change-Id: Iff9438bb7876decb3f31928a3c2f377b5434fbf9

commit_message:
helm-repository: make it work on non-x86

With 2.3.0 we can use upstream binaries on other architectures than
x86-64.

Partially-Implements: blueprint multiarch-and-arm64-containers

Change-Id: I5e13fea4a152079d0fbe72d8c39e0fe068562fc2

commit_message:
Don't use oslo-incubator in glance client plugin

There is plan to remove all oslo incubator code from the
clients. This removes the usage of deprecated
openstack.common.apiclient.exceptions in glance client
plugin.

The available glance HTTPNotFound exception is not usable
for validations(no message) and there is no UniqueMatch
exception.

This adds a new custom client_exception module with two
exceptions to ensure that the error messages remain the
same as before.

Change-Id: I5b32eef047a1fe38382f649532c8bb8a910315e5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/35/394735/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: from glanceclient.openstack.common.apiclient import exceptions self.assertRaises(exceptions.NotFound, self.assertRaises(exceptions.NoUniqueMatch, self.mock_find_image.side_effect = ["id1", exceptions.NotFound(), exceptions.NoUniqueMatch()]

commit_message:
Do not try to access CONF.ovs_vsctl_timeout at import time

This patch is creating a guard function around the code that uses the
CONF.ovs_vsctl_timeout configuration option to avoid it being accessed
at import time.

Prior to this patch, networking-ovn was broken with:  2017-04-21
12:36:44.810 CRITICAL neutron.plugins.ml2.managers [-] The 'ovn =
networking_ovn.ml2.mech_driver:OVNMechanismDriver' entrypoint could not
be loaded for the following reason: 'no such option ovs_vsctl_timeout in
group [DEFAULT]'

Change-Id: I338ac59c9bb38ebddfa1d4b2059e9a13e604bf09
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/35/458835/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _get_connection(): return = connection.Connection(idl_factory=connection.idl_factory, timeout=cfg.CONF.ovs_vsctl_timeout) return NeutronOvsdbIdl(_get_connection())

commit_message:
Using max api version in notification sample test

Notification payloads always reflect the data needed for every
supported API microversion so we can safely use the latest
API version in the notification sample tests. This helps the test
to use the new API features too.

Change-Id: I851bd2e7ef13a1efa4fed4176996d71f6e2de94a

This helps the test to use the new API # features too. max_version = api_version_request.max_api_version().get_string() self.api.microversion = max_version self.admin_api.microversion = max_version # NOTE(gibi): from microversion 2.19 the description is not set to the # instance name automatically but can be provided at boot. server['description'] = 'some-server'

commit_message:
Run neutron scenario multinode nv in nova experimental queue

This job tests all of the scenario tests in tempest, including
the slow ones.

Nova cares about these since things like encrypted volumes are
marked slow and tested in this job, which we otherwise don't
get that coverage.

Change-Id: If03ef48ba3162824d9d0456c6562b62c6b5e47e5
